com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal
Class BaseTofu

java.lang.Object
  com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu
All Implemented Interfaces:
SoyTofu
public class BaseTofu
extends Object
implements SoyTofu

Represents a compiled Soy file set. This is the result of compiling Soy to a Java object.

Important: Do not use outside of Soy code (treat as superpackage-private).

Method Detail

getNamespace

public String getNamespace()
Gets the namespace of this SoyTofu object. The namespace is simply a convenience allowing render() to be called with a partial template name (e.g. ".fooTemplate"). Note: The namespace may be null, in which case render() must be called with the full template name.

For objects of this class, the namespace is always null.

Specified by:
getNamespace in interface SoyTofu
Returns:
The namespace of this SoyTofu object, or null if no namespace.

forNamespace

public SoyTofu forNamespace(@Nullable
                            String namespace)
Description copied from interface: SoyTofu
Gets a new SoyTofu instance with a different namespace (or no namespace). Note: The new SoyTofu instance will still be backed by the same compiled Soy file set.

Specified by:
forNamespace in interface SoyTofu
Parameters:
namespace - The namespace for the new SoyTofu instance, or null for no namespace.
Returns:
A new SoyTofu instance with a different namespace (or no namespace).

render

public String render(SoyTemplateInfo templateInfo,
                     @Nullable
                     Map<String,?> data,
                     @Nullable
                     SoyMsgBundle msgBundle)
Description copied from interface: SoyTofu
Renders a template.

Note: If you call this method instead of SoyTofu.render(SoyTemplateInfo, SoyMapData, SoyMsgBundle), your template data will be converted to a SoyMapData object on each call. This may not be a big deal if you only need to use the data object once. But if you need to reuse the same data object for multiple calls, it's more efficient to build your own SoyMapData object and reuse it with SoyTofu.render(SoyTemplateInfo, SoyMapData, SoyMsgBundle).

Specified by:
render in interface SoyTofu
Parameters:
templateInfo - Info for the template to render.
data - The data to call the template with. Can be null if the template has no parameters.
msgBundle - The bundle of translated messages, or null to use the messages from the Soy source.
Returns:
The rendered text.

render

public String render(String templateName,
                     @Nullable
                     Map<String,?> data,
                     @Nullable
                     SoyMsgBundle msgBundle)
Renders a template.

Note: If you call this method instead of SoyTofu.render(String, SoyMapData, SoyMsgBundle), your template data will be converted to a SoyMapData object on each call. This may not be a big deal if you only need to use the data object once. But if you need to reuse the same data object for multiple calls, it's more efficient to build your own SoyMapData object and reuse it with SoyTofu.render(String, SoyMapData, SoyMsgBundle).

Specified by:
render in interface SoyTofu
Parameters:
templateName - The full name of the template to render.
data - The data to call the template with. Can be null if the template has no parameters.
msgBundle - The bundle of translated messages, or null to use the messages from the Soy source.
Returns:
The rendered text.
